values: I think my life has become a lot easier and happier since I started trying to ask myself "Is this going to bring me closer or push me farther away from people" before I do or say anything. Probably the scarier parts of life are when you can't come up with an answer. Things work themselves out, if you try though, I think.
I DIDN'T WANT TO MAKE A NEW JOURNAL BUT I GOT SICK OF MY OLD ONE SO THIS IS MY OLD ONE THAT I HAD BEFORE I GOT <lj user =catchnoplagues>.

THE JOURNAL IS DEAD.

 

for future refference.

If the lost word is lost, if the spent word is spent 
If the unheard, unspoken 
Word is unspoken, unheard; 
Still is the unspoken word, the Word unheard, 
The Word without a word, the Word within 
The world and for the world; 
And the light shone in darkness and 
Against the Word the unstilled world still whirled 
About the centre of the silent Word.

My mom said "Chris, I won't let you fast for 40 days because you're too thin", but you know what? Everyone needs to be rebellious sometimes.
40 DAYS IT IS.

Work was pretty sweet this weekend because I made like 10,000 dollars.

 


You're The Catcher in the Rye!
by J.D. Salinger
You are surrounded by phonies, and boy are you sick of them! In an ongoing struggle to search for a land without phonies, you end up running away from everything, from school to consequences. In this process, you reveal that many people in your life have suffered torments and all you really want to do is catch them as they fall. Perhaps using a baseball mitt. Your biggest fans are infamous psychotics.

I got to school late and went to the wrong classroom. Shit man. All the kids laughed. Laugh it up. I went to the library and read about Origen and Monothelitism while the suckers were in math class! WHO WAS LAUGHING? I was. Tommy Greene lent me a pen in the library! It was really nice of him, especially since I've only talked to him like once.

Molly and I didn't go to 5th period. Why would you when you could go to Wal Mart? I don't know. But we had a nice conversation about skinny heroin adicts and how they're hot. I did most of the listening.

I actually talked to people in Weightlifting today. I usually just sit around really quietly and watch other people. I guess people know me now, so I can't do that anymore. No more fly-on-the-weight-lifting-wall for me.

I'm going to explode before whenever.

Today was fuckin sweet. 

+I met with Mr. Carmine Calzonetti in Sea Cliff New York at Noon. 
He works with kids about volunteering abroad. 
I was kind of skeptical, but I really think I'm going to go with 
him now. 

Leave September 15th, come home for Winter Break.
Leave for Europe in February for 3 or 4 months. 
Get back end of Summer 2005.

+He said I would choose wherever the hell I wanted to
 go, and spend 2 to 3 weeks at a time there.
Also, I could take a week off whenever the hell I wanted to. This
is good. I could vacation in Flanders in my downtime. 

SWEET! FLANDERS!!!

+This is very promising

+6 hour car ride home.

+Seeing Taylor tomorrow, and Thursday is one month! Yeah! 
Awesome! 
We're going to have to go on a nice date! Where do people
eat around here? Or anywhere, really, I think I'll have the car. 

Where are good restaurants?

+Find out if I get the job at Border's today. That would 
be helpful. I hate when people talk about jobs in their journals.

If i was a serial killer i would be Albert Fish.

Albert Fish was a masochistic, pedophile obsessed with religious themes such as sin, sacrifice, and redemption through pain. It is believed that he would force his own children to beat him with a nail studded paddle until he bled. He would also stick nails underneath his finger nails,into his groin, his scrotum and his anus. He forced himself to eat feces and would stick alcohol soaked cotton balls up his anus and set them on fire.

Fish believed that God wanted him to castrate boys, which he would do over the course of many years, finally to be caught for kidnapping, murdering and eating a 10 year old girl. Fish claims to have molested over four hundred children. Police charged him with eight but suspect him on fifteen.

While I find it disheartening that so few people recognized the importance of today, I think this had its positive sides. Because nobody was making a big deal out of it, I was not caught up in united mourning as previously, but rather, I think I was given some time to reflect personally on the matter at hand. I learned that no sort of loss brings us to deserve any sort of special treatment, because the business of comparing tragedies to tragedies is a foolish one to get into. I learned not to feel jealous when other people talk about how close they were, because any sort of bond we had doesn't need to verified or proven posthumously. Most importantly, I learned that it doesn't matter how people act, because nobody ever forgets.

The mars volta cd sucks. Also, the still life LP "From Angry Heads to Skyward Eyes" came out on CD on ebullition. The LP came out over a thousand years ago, and it rules.

oh yeah the biggest goddamned letdowns were On The Might of Princes - Sirens, and Against Me! - As the eternal cowboy. what the hell happened to both of them? They got shitty, that's what.

Today has been really nice so far. It's raining now and it feels like the first week of school when I hated physics and came home and listened to Christie Front Drive and talked to Amalia online for about a thousand hours. There's something about rain after school where all music hits you about twice as hard, especially if it's nice comforting music. I went to school today, and worked on my St. Athanasius vs. Arius the Archpriest project. Ceramics was good because nobody was being loud or boistrous. Everyone just kind of sat around and nobody cared that I didn't say anything, and people smiled and laughed when I did. I like when that happens, it makes me want to talk less. After that I came down with a horrible headache, so I went to pick up taylor at school and we saw a movie. Nobody was there, so we lay around in the aisles and got to talk during the film without getting yelled at. I had a good time. I went back to physics, and then came home. 

All day I couldn't stop thinking about how teen culture and what's cool is marketed around being rebellious and "extreme", so the only real way to rebel against any sort of infrastructure is to revert to a simpler, less extreme lifestyle. It made me want to live in a small house on a big field, and herd sheep and plant seeds  every year. Maybe it wouldn't even be a house. It'd be like a house in first century canaan - various cells and rooms for people on different levels or floors, with a big pod on the bottom for the animals to stay in the middle. I don't know where this could take place, but it'd have to be nice. It'd have to be really nice.
I was kind of disappointed today. But I got over it. Then, I went to buy Laura cigarettes! Matt was there. I really want to piss on him again, but he was gone when I came back outside. Great.

Why is childhood meaningful? Experiences, the second source of meaning in life, according to Viktor Frankl. However, by all means, Childhood shouldn't be a meaningful experience. All we do is seek temporary happiness. I saw Peter Pan the other day, and that's basically what it was about. Wendy wanted to grow up so she could find meaning in her life. Peter didn't want to, because he wanted to dick around and have fun all the time. Why is such a meaningless early-life such a memorable and valuable experience? I don't get it. But I like it alot.

Is it possible to make a society in which we praise communication and closeness with all others, while still glorifying privacy? How can we grant ourselves the conveniences of complete immersion with others, while simultaneously demanding "our space"? Simply, by expecting people to be less than people, or at least by taking a divisive stance on the question of how to treat people in varying situations. Get to know people. Get to know everyone. 


EVERYONE.

Me and Barcode were both simultaneously, independent of each other, taking breaks from reading the same solzhenitsyn book to eat homemade cookies and play old SNES RPGS. EXTREMELY IMPROBABLE! BUT IT HAPPENED! 

Joel's new machine = celebratory ACTION. We'll talk. 

Winter break started off like the world ending.
like the world ending.
like the world ending.
NOT WITH A BANG BUT WITH A WHIMPER. 

Me and will sat in my room listening to MC5 and Deep Purple, reading Calvin and Hobbes and Red Meat. This is by far the nerdiest use of a friday night I've made in a long time, but it was also REALLYFUCKINCOOL. 

We lost the debate, but it was just because my team sucked and everyone went in a different direction. Mr. Connoly said I set up a good argument, and it took the other team the entire time to dismantle it. I suspect if my team understood it, they perhaps would have been able to back it up...

I said that although there have been undiscountable advances in fields like technology, medicine, science, all of which make our lives easier and more comfortable, it is self-evident that they do not make our lives any more meaningful. The question is what the goal of life and the goals of civilization are, as obvously a civilization can neither fail nor succeed without having goals. The goal of indiivdual lives is to find a balance between meaning and happiness, and by any means, civilization should not hinder this. Although it is easy to live a long life of an affluent lifestyle, civilization has made it no easier to find meaning in life than ever before. If anything, I suspect it was easier to find meaning in a life of humble and pastoral simplicity than it is in a complex age of technology and communication. Self-sufficience is by no means the end all be all state of happiness - if anything, it is a wall we build around ourselves. 

Arcadia has forsake us, as we have it. 

I would sound like Polpot in saying that EVERYTHING MUST GO. 

Never kill for what you believe. Never, ever, kill for what you believe. We must be nothing if not consistent.

Return of the King was amazing, although I was rather upset that they decided to omit substantial elaboration on the 4th Age, The battle of bywater, the statues at Cirith Ungol, etc... I think that was all acceptable, but thye just didn't get the end. It was too conclusive - a major point in the end was that there is no escaping an atmosphere like the one that seemed pervasive in the journey - an atmosphere of battle, adventure, and meaning. Much like anyone returning from fighting a "good cause", entire lives seem drab and anti-climactic, I would imagine particularly such a pastoral life as the one portrayed in the movie. I think this may be the most personal touch Tolkien put on the entire story, undoubtedly drawing from his wartime experience. I hope it makes the extended version. On the plus side, the rest RULED.
Today I stopped doing things because I had to, and started doing things because someone had to.

Last night, we stayed up until 7 AM playing Dance Dance Revolution and planning on brewing our own meade. It snowed, but it got plowed. I went to bed after finding out saddam hussein got caught. I was kind of happy about that, I really didn't like that guy from the get-go.  All in all, it was a productive evening. 

p.s. Everyone go here:
http://downhillbattle.org/riaa/index.html
Some guys made Anti-RIAA stickers to put on CDS in stores.

I won the class's poetry slam. I got three 10's, a 9.9, and a 9.95. Mr. Connoley wants a copy of the poem, because he said something about there being layers or something. I don't really think it's that good, and I'd rather have read my essay, which was about why the trickle down theory sucks. Awesome! Ha! The trickle down theory sucks! Good stuff happened today, but it just feels like it was a bad day retrospectively. Maybe it's because I'm tired, but maybe nobody wants to read about how tired I am.
Isn't it crazy that in the post-industrial age, the term public has reverted to meaning "belonging to everyone" instead of "belonging to no one"? I like it.

I had a fever for the past two days, so I've been sleeping alot. I'm starting to get that feeling after you've had a fever that you really want to get out and about though, like it's Spring and everything's coming back. The juvenescence of the year, I guess. I started reading the fountainhead, and beat contra III. It's been a nice "Change of pace". I'm going to go take another shower.

They are the best of times, they'll be the worst of times. Two Hour Delay instead of school cancellation, because I stayed up until 2 and didn't do any of my homework. Hung out with Will and Andy and Robyn and Sarah - It was a delight. Today my shirt smelled like ass because I didn't wash it after I got it from Yesterday's Rose. Gross! Ugh! Ewwwww! Disgusting. totally nasty, ugh it was gross as hell. Blahhhh, oh fucking sick. I thought I was gonna barf when I realized that. It was frockin unclean. oh man, I need to take a shower, FAST. Somebody who played soccer in Western Howard County needs to be totally more hygienic, or STOP GIVING THEIR CLOTHES AWAY. Man, that put a damper on the evening. I guess you stop being self-conscious or something when you're older. Oh, I can't wait until I'm older. REALLY older, like 80. But I wouldn't want to be right now. I wish I'd already lived out my life, because sometimes I think reflection is alot more rewarding than looking forward. Or maybe I'm just lazy.
I'm doing a REALLY good job of not sucking this week! This is a very nice change in pace.
This is my mantra.
